Class orderingTrendsController

java.lang.Object
orderingTrendsController
public class orderingTrendsController extends Object
Controller for the ordering trends analytics screen.

Shows the top 6 most ordered drinks with images, the peak sales week and hour, and displays a bar chart that shows the 5 most ordered drinks within a time frame.

Data taken from tables order and beverage in the database.

  • Constructor Details

    • orderingTrendsController

      public orderingTrendsController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      JavaFX lifecycle hook.

      Initialize is called automatically by the FXML loader This method:

      • Loads and renders the top 6 most popular drinks.
      • Loads and renders the peak sales week and hour.
      • creates the fillchart action for a button to get bar chart data for a selected range.

    • loadPeakWeek

      public void loadPeakWeek()
      Queries database to get the week with the most sales using the sum of total_price. It then updates the peakDay label.

      Uses query that groups rows in the order table by week, calculates the sum of the total_price per week, then sorts it in descending order and takes the first row.

      If no rows are returned it returns no data. When it has an SQL error it returns DB error.

    • loadPeakHour

      public void loadPeakHour()
      Queries database to find the hour with the most sales and updates the peakHour label.

      The query groups rows in the order table by hour and calculates the sum of total_price epr hour.It then sorts in descending and takes the first row.

      If no rows are returned it returns no data, on sql error it returns db error.

    • loadTop6PopularDrinks

      public void loadTop6PopularDrinks()
      Loads the six most frequently ordered beverages across all orders and fills the six popular item labels in order of popularity.

      Query joins table order and beverage on order_id, counts how many times beverage_name is ordered, sorts them in descending order and limits to 6.

      Only fills out labels for results that are available.

    • fillBarChart

      public void fillBarChart()
      Builds and displays the bar chart for the top 5 most ordered beverages in a select range between startDate and endDate.

      The method waits for two dates to be selected to work, it queries the top 5 beverages by count where the combine_date is between the two chosen dates. It then creates a new XYchart.Series and populates it with (beverage_name,count) pairs.

      SQL takes two parameters, start date and end date.

    • handleBackButton

      public void handleBackButton()
      Handles the button that returns to the previous page.

      Loads managerMenu.fxml and swaps the current Stage scene to display the manager menu screen.

      If the FXML doesnt load or doesnt exist, the stack trace is printed.
